message.content: This question tests knowledge about bird habitats. Birds can make their homes in various places, but one common place is groves of plants. This is because plants provide shelter and protection for birds. Options (B), (C), and (D) are also possible habitats for birds, but they are not as commonly associated with bird homes as groves of plants.

This question requires basic knowledge about bird habitats. Birds can make their homes in various places, and one common habitat is groves of plants. They often nest in trees, bushes, or other vegetation found in groves. Option (B) is incorrect because waterways are more common habitats for aquatic birds such as ducks or herons. Option (C) is incorrect because most birds do not make their homes in city streets, although they may be found in urban areas. Option (D) is incorrect because although birds may visit and feed in public parks, they do not typically make their homes there.
